intro: Memecylon umbellatum var. molestum, commonly known as the rough memecylon, is a tropical shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in primary rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the understory vegetation in its native habitat.
